intro: Echites javitensis, commonly known as the Java echites, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Echites javitensis is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
